messages.subject: URL - kinda helpful
messages.msgSnippet: If you find something with a loooooooooong URL, you can visit http://www.tinyurl.com then paste in the long URL.  It will automatically create a tiny URL -
messages.messageBody:
If you find something with a loooooooooong URL, you
can visit http://www.tinyurl.com then paste in the
long URL. It will automatically create a 'tiny URL' -
basically a short redirect link for yours.

And it's free :)

Kathy

messages.msgSnippet: For most email programs, urls come through better if you put  around them.  Also - hit return right before a link so it
messages.messageBody:
For most email programs, urls come through better if you put < and >
around them.

<www.sandradodd.com/unschooling>

Also - hit return right before a link so it starts on its own line.

-pam

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] MOVIES  (was Re: Hi! New with question....._
messages.msgSnippet: ... http://sandradodd.com/movies_ For some reason whenever Sandra puts a link in an email it comes out like the above with that little extra _ on it. So I
messages.messageBody:
SandraDodd@... wrote:

>
> In a message dated 6/12/2005 4:07:15 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
> dawnadams@... writes:
>
> Links weren't working. :(
>
>
http://sandradodd.com/movies_
For some reason whenever Sandra puts a link in an email it comes out
like the above with that little extra _ on it. So I click on the link
then once it goes to a "page not found" I just backspace over the _ and
then hit enter. Vola! Linky works.


--

Julie W

http://jwoolfolk.typepad.com/theothermother/

messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] MOVIES  (was Re: Hi! New with question....._
messages.msgSnippet: when you click on the link and it comes up wrong in your browser it usually means an added symbol was included in the link. In this case, I had ] at the end
messages.messageBody:
when you click on the link and it comes up wrong in your browser it usually
means an added symbol was included in the link. In this case, I had "]" at
the end of the link...be deleting that symbol and hitting enter, I get the
intended page. This happens a lot for me with links in email....an easy fix
though.

~April
Mom to Kate-18, Lisa-16, Karl-14, & Ben-9.
*REACH Homeschool Grp, an inclusive group in Oakland County
http://www.homeschoolingonashoestring.com/REACH_home.html

http://www.michiganyouththeater.org/

success."
Albert Einstein (1879-1955)

messages.subject: MOVIES  (was Re: Hi! New with question....._
messages.msgSnippet: I m working on a webpage about movies (to help unschoolers loosen up and frolic) and found this: _http://www.lucasfilm.com/_ (http://www.lucasfilm.com/) Just
messages.messageBody:
I'm working on a webpage about movies (to help unschoolers loosen up and
frolic) and found this:
_http://www.lucasfilm.com/_ (http://www.lucasfilm.com/)
Just play with the opening screen a bit.

If a kid is studying art or literature or math (engineering/programming),
that page could be considered purely academic time.

-=-Then it said that time on the computer for academics shouldn't count
against the kid's screen time, thereby contradicting their earlier statement that
too much *time* with TV etc. is just plain bad for kids.-=-

Yeah, I can't decide which I dislike more, hypcricy or bullshit. Finding
them both in one place like that is just....

well nevermind that, look at this!

_http://www.lucasfilm.com/_ (http://www.lucasfilm.com/)
<bwg>

And the movie page, in its current just-getting-started form is here:
_http://sandradodd.com/movies_ (http://sandradodd.com/movies)

Sandra
